title: Baby Back Ribs, Smoked to Perfection

Ingredients.8: 0.25 cup barbeque sauce (such as KC Masterpiece® Original), or to taste

Directions.1: Place 3 fist-sized chunks of wood in a smoker and heat to 250 degrees F (121 degrees C).

Directions.2: While the wood burns down, mix salt, pepper, garlic powder, onion powder, chili powder, and cumin together in a bowl. Apply rub to both sides of ribs.

Directions.3: Add ribs to the smoker, bone-side down, once a thin blue smoke appears. Smoke for 2 hours.

Directions.4: Reduce heat to 225 to 250 degrees F (107 to 121 degrees C). Wrap ribs lightly in aluminum foil to retain juices. Continue smoking for 1 1/2 hours more.

Directions.5: Remove foil and continue to smoke until meat is tender but still stays on the bone, about 1 hour more, brushing lightly with barbeque sauce in the last 15 minutes. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read 145 degrees F (63 degrees C).
